climbs.name: Aussi beau que c'en a l'air
climbs.fa: Mark Aubrey and Guy Lacelle, March 1990

content.description:
Sustained steepness and generally untouched ice on this rarely climbed classic make it a worthy route for those tired of climbing pegboards. The name means "As beautiful as it looks" but it felt like the title of its neighbor, "Harder Than It Looks", applied equally.

P1) 5+ through two curtains to a cave on the left

P2) 5+ up a larger curtain to a large ledge

P3) A step of 4 a short walk up the snowy ledge

Rappel on threads



Take the road directly opposite the Kinney Lake Road, cross the river, and continue until you reach parking at the first train tracks. The crossing here is private and marked no trespassing. Hike up the road to the second train tracks, then go EAST / LEFT (west in old JoJo guidebook) a hundred meters until you reach an obvious avalanche path. Go up the path to the base of the route. Everything after the parking is marked "no trespassing".

climbs.name: Harder Than It Looks
climbs.fa: Doug Dean and Bill March, Mar 1985

content.description:
A worthwhile, long route in a beautiful amphitheater with views of the south face of Mt Robson. This is the left climb. Aussi beau que c'en a l'air is on the right.

P1) A short step to the base of the long flow. 20m WI3

P2) The main flow has a steep center section and more moderate start and end. Belay at the top of the steeps or link into P3. 30m WI4

P3) Continue up moderate terrain and a snow slope to the base of the final flow. 40m WI3

P4) Tackle the final curtain. 35m WI4

Rappel from v-threads



Take the road directly opposite the Kinney Lake Road, cross the river, and continue until you reach parking at the first train tracks. The crossing here is private and marked no trespassing. Hike up the road to the second train tracks, then go EAST / LEFT (west in old JoJo guidebook) a hundred meters until you reach an obvious avalanche path. Go up the path to the base of the route. Everything after the parking is marked "no trespassing".

Directly across the highway from the Mount Robson Visitor Center lies Mount Klapperhorn. Its lower slopes are home to at least two known ice climbs - Aussi beau que c'en a l'air and Harder Than It Looks.
